hanzi-su-wiki:
畳

Значения

Циновка «татами»; накапливать, складывать, свертывать; суффикс для счёта циновок

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Вверху — тюк с товаром 田. Жить должно 宜 так, чтобы скопить состояние.

Варианты

疊, 叠, 疉, 疂

疊疊RS
叠叠		疂疉畳repeat, duplicate, repetitious, tatami

  • a table with cover 冝 standing on the tatami mat 畾/田
  • ⓢ united 叒 work to provide food on the table 冝 is repetitious
heisig_constituent: tatami mat, rice field, brains, crown, shelf, my bookshelves
Keyword_KANJIDIC: tatami mat, counter for tatami mats, fold, shut up, do away with
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: таты, счетчик для тат, сложите, заткнитесь, избавиться от
koohiiStory1: The king is peacefully sleeping on his new tatami mat when all of a sudden a shelf falls over and kills him. You can see his crown poking out and the brains splatter out the top of his head from all the pressure.
koohiiStory2: Making tatami mats from rice field waste was Japan´s crowning achievement, but for some reason other countries just shelved the idea.
kunYomi: たた.む、たたみ、かさ.なる
jp_example_words:
畳(じょう): counter for tatami mats, measure of room size (in mat units)
畳む(たたむ): fold (clothes)
畳(たたみ): tatami mat
jp_readingExamples: 畳む (たた.む), 畳 (たたみ)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: In the rice paddy there is a forehead with a top hat. It sits atop an area of tatami mats.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: The meaning you're trying to learn is tatami mat, so focus on the beautiful tatami mats that are strangely in the middle of this rice paddy. On top is a forehead with a top hat. It almost looks like the tatami mats are an altar for this gruesome scene.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Who made this creepy tatami mat altar? It was Jourm (じょう) the increasingly concerning farmhand who lives in your village.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You saw Jourm setting up the tatami mats a day earlier, but you thought he was just making an area for workers in the field to rest in. Does the forehead with a top hat have anything to do with Jourm? Did he... do something bad?
Ru_Russian:
татами (соломенный мат стандартного размера)
счётное слово для соломенных матов
дзё, мера жилой площади (один мат) = чуть больше 1.65 кв.м.
Ru_Meaning: tatami mat, counter for tatami mats, fold, shut up, do away with
Ru_Notes: Татами — соломенный мат стандартного размера, чуть больше 1.6 кв. м, очень плотный, служит для настилки полов.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: and another (且) rice field (田) is covered (冖) and folded up into tatami

dié
яп. вм. 叠
Radicals: 田, 冖, 且  (rice-paddy, forehead, top-hat)
Meaning Mnemonic
In the rice paddy there is a forehead with a top hat. It sits atop an area of tatami mats.
The meaning you're trying to learn is tatami mat, so focus on the beautiful tatami mats that are strangely in the middle of this rice paddy. On top is a forehead with a top hat. It almost looks like the tatami mats are an altar for this gruesome scene.
Reading Mnemonic
Who made this creepy tatami mat altar? It was Jourm (じょう) the increasingly concerning farmhand who lives in your village.
You saw Jourm setting up the tatami mats a day earlier, but you thought he was just making an area for workers in the field to rest in. Does the forehead with a top hat have anything to do with Jourm? Did he... do something bad?

Examples: 畳む (たた.む), 畳 (たたみ)
一 (один), 冖 (ва), 田 (рисовое поле)
Татами — соломенный мат стандартного размера, чуть больше 1.6 кв. м, очень плотный, служит для настилки полов.
